author: pdp
content: Hugo, darknets are not honeypots. In fact, they are the opposite to honeypots. While honeypots try to look interesting in order to attract the attacker's attention, darknets are mostly sitting passively waiting for someone to come in. They are not designed to look interesting but the simple fact that someone is sending packets to them is very, very, intriguing and suspicious.

author: Gustavo Cardial
content:
"The opposite of honeypots", very interesting concept!

That's like when my computer is connected but there are no programs running (just a sniffer). When there's incoming traffic, it's often bots/worms/etc scanning my IP range (it's easy to know what it is depending on the packets or the port utilized... Google helps a lot here!)

author: synjunkie
content: or even more interesting when there is outgoing traffic!
